post_text: The Elyria community is grieving the loss of a family of five in a tragedy that occurred last night in the city. With profound sadness we must report that the three children who died—all siblings—were students in our school district. This devastating news has deeply shaken our staff and school community. On Monday, an Elyria Schools team of counselors and social workers trained in trauma and crisis care will be available for students, parents and staff who are in need of support. The counselors will be at Elyria High School on Monday, Aug. 3, from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. (Visitors may enter through the Performing Arts Center.) Please reach out if you or your child would like to talk. We send our sincerest condolences to friends and relatives of the family.

post_text: Today we take you on another virtual tour: Franklin Elementary School! Franklin, located on 11th St. in Elyria, permanently closed in May 2020. The brand-new Hamilton Elementary School, housed at 13th St. and Middle Ave., will open in September serving students in preschool through fourth grade. The Franklin building on 11th St. (built in 1950) was the first school built away from the downtown site of Elyria High School. It has a fascinating history. We hope you enjoy! (Historic photos courtesy of Aaron Lewis, as well as Bill Bird, former director, and Eric Greely, archivist, of the Lorain County Historical Society.)

post_text: Hello families and happy summer! We've already begun the process of working on our plan to return to school in the fall and Governor DeWine's news conference today reiterating that initiative across the state is welcome news. We want to assure you we will work to meet the needs of your family as your students return or work online. We released a survey today to our parents that will help us see more specifically what their needs are as it relates to technology and their intent to return to in-person schooling in the fall. Parents should check their home email addresses to find the survey link embedded within the district's Learning at Home newsletter. If they did not receive the survey through the latest issue of Learning at Home, please email us at ask@elyriaschools.org and we'll send you the link. Parents/Guardians: Your input is important! Please complete the online survey (only seven questions long) by July 10, 2020. Thank you!

Pero’s students were invited during short windows of time to come and see the library. Elementary Art Teacher Heather Hale created the mosaic on the outside of the beautiful little library that Mr. Terry and helpers handcrafted months ago.

post_text: Good morning, Pioneers! This week coming up we’re kicking off a fun social media series called “This Senior” to highlight members of our senior class. If you’re an Elyria High School Senior, or the proud parent of one, send us a picture that we can use on social media and a short note about your after-high-school plans.
